page.title: 17HUDNALL COMMON
page.content: Hudnall Common near Gt Gaddesden has its ECOLOGY closely monitored by local conservationists and the Herts Schools Field Centre at Hudnall Park, run by Mr John Leonhardt.The Common was once a grazing place for sheep, it is now SHRUBLAND. Until 30 years ago there was a large number of rabbits but an outbreak of Myxamatosis killed many of them.Muntjac & Fallow deer inhabit the Common today.Clustered Bell FLOWERS, which are rare, are seen near the roadside. The NATIONAL TRUST owns the Common and it is illegal to uproot any of the flowers.
